alert.note: Alert for Eastern, Central, and Southern Searcy County Higher Elevations; Pope County Higher Elevations; Southeast Van Buren County; Stone; Van Buren County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 10:14AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Stone, southern Searcy, Van Buren and northeastern Pope Counties through 1045 AM CDT... At 1014 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Witts Spring to near Dabney to Solo. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clinton... Fairfield Bay... Shirley... Kay... Claude... Witts Spring... Rocky Hill... Dabney... Solo... Smyrna... Bohannon... Elba... Woolum... Imo... Old Lexington... Choctaw... Elberta... Watts... Marsena... Leslie... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for central and north central Arkansas.
